content: QuoteThe Economic and Financial Crimes Commission on Monday arrested an operations manager of a leading commercial bank in Abuja Central Area for refusing to load the Automated Teller Machines, ATMs, of the bank despite having N29 million of the redesigned Naira notes in the branch’s vaults. Before he was whisked away for further questioning, the operatives ordered the loading of all the ATMs and the payment of the stipulated amount across the counter to the delight of the distraught customers who had spent hours in queues without getting the new notes.Source: https://www.vanguardngr.com/2023/02/sabotage-efcc-arrests-abuja-bank-manager-for-hoarding-n29-million-new-notes/amp/The past few weeks has been a living hell for nigerians as many persons could not have access to their cash even with CBN claiming that it has released 85% of the newly redesigned naira notes to the commercial banks for circulation. The operatives of the Economic and Financial Crime Commission agency (EFCC) yesterday in Abuja arrested the bank manager of a commercial bank for hoarding N29M naira new notes. According to the informent dem deliberately no gree dispense the new notes say e no dey. As EFCC dey go round dey monitor the situation for the area, come see the large number of persons wey queue up dey wait to withdraw their money. As dem enter the bank, dem come ask the bank manager say dem want see the vault and when dem open the vault naso dem see the new naira notes starched inside. Naso dem give order say make them immediately load up the ATM machines with the cash and start to the pay customers over the counter and dem come arrest the bank manager carry am commot. This information really sweet me for belle and I hope to see more of such persons hoarding the new naira notes arrested.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: In Igbo there is adjective that perfectly describes the current reality of what Nigerians are going through - "Ikeguru". I am tired. We are all tired. Right now Nigerians do not know who is playing Who. We did not even know who is telling the truth and who is lying. We do not know whether the cbn governor is lying to us and whether the bank managers are actually telling us the truth that there is no money in the bank. We cannot tell if the whole EFCC and ICPC blowing hot is all part of the plot. But what I know is that the masses are just pawns in the whole game

comments.created_time: February 09, 2023, 09:35:58 PMLast edit: February 09, 2023, 09:48:51 PM by sokani
comments.body: QuoteTwo Sterling Bank managers in Abuja have been apprehended by the Independent Corrupt Practices and Other Related Offences Commission (ICPC). A statement from the ICPC disclosed that its operatives arrested the Regional and Service Managers of the financial institution last Friday for hoarding N258 million in the bank’s vault. The new Naira notes were given to Sterling Bank by the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) to disbursement to customers to ease the tension caused by Naira scarcity.Source: https://businesspost.ng/banking/icpc-arrests-sterling-bank-managers-for-hoarding-n258m-new-notes/Good job to these guys. These managers don't even have conscience, N258 million naira is a huge amount of money. How can someone hoard such an amount of money while a lot of persons are suffering? God help us in this country. I just hope they would be made to face the full wrath of the law.
